metadata.title: CVE-2014-0065 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple buffer overflows in PostgreSQL before 8.4.20, 9.0.x before 9.0.16,9.1.x before 9.1.12, 9.2.x before 9.2.7, and 9.3.x before 9.3.3 allowremote authenticated users to have unspecified impact and attack vectors, adifferent vulnerability than CVE-2014-0063.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.3-1
libecpg6 - 9.3.3-1
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.3-1
libpq5 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
No subscription required

postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1.12-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.3-1').
postgresql-9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.1.12-1').
